name: Glossary - SSO Explained
title: Glossary - SSO Explained
body:
Term Explanation
SSO - Single Sign On A method that allows a user to access multiple services with one set of login credentials.
MFA - Multi Factor Authentication A security system that requires more than one method of authentication from independent categories of credentials.
Federation/Federated Authentication A method that links and manages identities across different systems or organizations.
IdP - Identity Provider Our own identity provider will be used to federate other providers and enable single sign on for EFS users. For some clients, it may have users stored at the IdP directly.
External IdP The external Identity Provider is owned by a client or customer of tivian and its users will be federated.
Social Provider A social Provider is mostly similar for our use case but has a different kind of connection to our IdP. Its users will be federated.
Local Users Users stored at our IdP. They are used to login to EFS/Portals.
External Users Users stored in an IdP (for example Azure Active Directory) that is not part of the IAM solution.
EFS/Portals The core target software for this project.
Installation User A user that exists locally in one installation with credentials.
